sops.title: SOP 1: Adding/Subtracting Algebraic Fractions
sops.goal: Combine fractions with algebraic denominators into a single fraction
steps: Find the LCD (Lowest Common Denominator): Factor all denominators if needed, then find LCD
Convert each fraction: Multiply numerator and denominator by whatever makes the denominator = LCD
Combine numerators: Add or subtract the numerators over the common denominator
Simplify: Factor and cancel common factors if possible

pitfalls.text: Not distributing the negative sign when subtracting fractions
Forgetting to multiply both numerator AND denominator when converting

pro_tips: When subtracting, put brackets around the entire second numerator: (a) - (b + c)
Always factor the final numerator and denominator to check for further simplification

sops.title: SOP 2: Solving Fractional Equations
sops.goal: Eliminate fractions and solve for the variable
steps: Identify the LCD of all denominators in the equation
Multiply every term by the LCD: This eliminates all fractions
Simplify and solve: You now have a standard linear or quadratic equation
Check for extraneous solutions: Substitute back to ensure denominators ≠ 0

pitfalls.text: Forgetting to multiply ALL terms (including constants) by the LCD
Not checking if solutions make any denominator zero

pro_tips: Write 'LCD = ...' at the top before multiplying
Circle any values that would make denominators zero—these cannot be solutions

sops.title: SOP 3: Changing the Subject of a Formula
sops.goal: Rearrange to isolate a specified variable
steps: Identify the target variable: Circle or highlight what you're solving for
Isolate terms containing the target: Move all other terms to the opposite side
If target appears multiple times, factor it out: x(stuff) = other stuff
Final isolation: Divide both sides to leave target alone
Simplify if needed: Especially with fractions

pitfalls.text: Not factoring out when the variable appears in multiple terms
Sign errors when moving terms across the equals sign

pro_tips: When target is in denominator, first multiply both sides by that denominator
If target is squared, remember to take ± square root at the end

sops.title: SOP 4: Solving Simultaneous Equations
sops.goal: Find values that satisfy both equations
steps: Choose your method: Substitution (if one equation is already solved for a variable) or Elimination
Elimination method: Multiply equations to make coefficients of one variable equal, then add/subtract to eliminate
Solve for first variable: You'll get a simple equation in one variable
Substitute back: Plug the value into either original equation to find the other variable
Verify: Check both values satisfy both original equations

pitfalls.text: Not multiplying the entire equation when preparing for elimination
Forgetting to find the second variable after eliminating the first

pro_tips: Label equations as ① and ② to track your work
If coefficients are already opposites, add. If they're the same, subtract
